caption.title: Heatmap of R^2, a pairwise measure of genetic linkage between sites.
caption.p: For pairs of biallelic sites (ignoring rare variants), R^2 was used to estimate how strongly the allele in one site predicts the allele in the second site, with values of 0 indicating no linkage and 1 indicating perfect linkage. The mean value of R^2 was 0.044, indicating very low levels of linkage overall.
Click here for additional data file.
